document.docAuthor: Pham, Nhi Thi, Broad, Gavin R. & Wägele, Wolfgang J.
document.docOrigin: Journal of Natural History (J. Nat. Hist.) 47 (23 - 24)
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Theronia genus-group (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae) from Vietnam with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Theronia genus-group (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae) from Vietnam with descriptions of five new species

Pimpla zebra
Vollenhoven, 1879
. Stett. Ent. Ztg. 40: 147. Holotype : ♀ , Indonesia : Java , Ambarawa (RMNH).

Theronia zebra iridipennis Cameron, 1907
. Tijdschr. Ent. 50: 99. Holotype : ♂ , India : Sikkim (BMNH).

Clypeus with two median swellings, more distinct in male than in female; mesopleuron with drop-like black mark joined or nearly joined to black stripe below subalar prominence; propodeum with vestige of basal transverse carina, pleural part of posterior transverse carina complete or partly present; first tergite 1.2–1.5 × longer than its apical width.

This species was recorded from Vietnam for the first time by Garthwaite and Desai (1939) . Outside Vietnam , it has been recorded from China , Taiwan , Brunei , India , Sri Lanka , Myanmar , Thailand , Malaysia , Singapore , Indonesia and the Philippines ( Gupta 1962 ; Yu et al. 2005 ; Amanda et al. 2011 ).

Three subspecies are currently recognized:
T. zebra zebra
,
T. zebra diluta Gupta
and
T. zebra iridipennis Cameron. The
differences between these subspecies are based on details of the colour patterns. The specimens from Vietnam belong to
T. zebra iridipennis
, which is characterized by mostly black body markings, hyaline wings, dark brown antenna and dorsally separated, dark stripes on the hind femur.
